Somers is a very small suburban farm town. Most known for Little Sorrel Lane where a Somers horse was ridden by Stonewall Jackson in the battle of Chancellorsville. The town has many traditions, such as participating in the four town fair parade every year along with bordering towns. Somers has always been an agricultural town with many potato, tobacco, and dairy farms and there are many animals and ranches. For example, horseback riding is a very big in Somers. Somers is a very wealthy town with beautiful houses, in 2007 it was named 53rd on Money Magazine’s list of 100 Best Places to Live.

The people of Somers are all very close with one another, mainly because of the fact that it is such a small town. There is only one elementary, middle, and high school in the whole town and they are ll right together in the same area. So, basically everyone in the town knows one another. The Somers community always comes together in times of need, one major thing that has happened that will help you understand this town is the recent incident in 2012 where the Somers Congregational Church was set on fire. The people of Somers all came together to support and help one another out.

Somers is a great little country town but there can also be a lot to do if you just look a little closer.

By Car: Somers is a small town  surrounded by Enfield and Stafford Connecticut. If your coming from Enfield, go right on to route 190 (Hazard Ave. and it will take you straight through Somers. If you are coming from the Stafford direction go west until your on route 190 also and you will get to Somers.

By Plane: The closest airport is Bradley International Airport which is in Windsor Locks, Connecticut. This is only about 30 minutes away from Somers.

Somers is a very small town so there isn't any type of public transportation; the most frequent way people get around is by car. Although, especially at the center of town you will see many people walking or riding bikes, and there are plenty of sidewalks in that area to do so. Although a lot of the back roads don't have sidewalks, there are barely ever any cars on the back streets in Somers. Main Street goes right through Somers and that is the street that will give you access to most of the things that Somers has like restaurants, gas stations, car dealership, e.tc. Most of the back roads of Somers are just houses, farms, and fields.

Somers is a very beautiful town; everything for the most part is very nice to look at. But if you are looking to see a really beautiful view there is one amazing spot to go to that most people don’t know about aside from Somers’s Natives.  It is Soap Stone Mountain, it is a little complicated to get to but so worth it once you do. It is pretty far back at the end of town, you will be driving down the road and it will come to an end. One you get there walk the rest of the way, which is only a small path. You will see a wooden loft with stairs, climb up and there you will see a beautiful view of the mountains and the town. If you only have time to go to one place in Somers this is the place to go.

Somers also has any fields and animals to look at, if you drive around you will see many crops and farms. This town in particular always has seasonal crops and activities going on, such as pumpkin patches and Christmas tree farms.

Somers is a small town so depending on your age you could find a very hard time finding things to do. The things listed below are great, but aside from them the town is very small and there isn’t much more to do. This town definitely has more to offer for an older crowd, or people who are looking for a quieter feel. People who are looking for places to go out on the weekend and younger people who like to go out would prefer another town to stay.

If you have kids, a great place to take the kids is to the park on Field Road. It is huge and is one of the nicest newest parks around. They have 3 softball fields, 2 baseball fields, 2 all purpose fields, tennis courts, a basketball court, and two sand volleyball courts. They also have a small kid's park section.

content=Great place to go if you are interested in getting your child involved in horse-back riding. It is a very popular part of Somers and hosts many horse shows.

There aren't many places to shop in Somers just because it is so small, most people who are looking for a mall or other basic shops go to the bordering town, Enfield which is only minutes away. Although, Somers does have a couple small stores if anyone is interested in antiquing.Most of these shops are for adults and older people, there aren't many stores in Somers for kids, teens, or young adults. Stores like this can be found right off of Main Street or South Road.
